title: Backend API endpoints for frontend consumption
description:

- GET /api/streams - list all streams with filtering support
- GET /api/channel-groups - list channel groups (for filter dropdowns)
- GET /api/stream-groups - list stream groups (for filter dropdowns)
- GET /api/providers - list M3U accounts/providers (for filter dropdowns)
- POST /api/channels/{id}/add-stream - add stream to channel
- POST /api/channels/{id}/remove-stream - remove stream from channel
- Query params for filtering: channel_group, m3u_account, search/name

title: Fix EPG matching not stripping channel number prefixes
description:
Channel names with number prefixes like "5033 | CW" were not being properly normalized for EPG matching. After alphanumeric normalization, the result was "5033cw" instead of "cw", causing no EPG matches to be found.

## Root Cause
The separator stripping regex wasn't matching all separator characters, and after the final alphanumeric normalization, leading digits remained.

## Fix
Added a final pass in normalizeForEPGMatch() to strip any remaining leading digits after the alphanumeric normalization step.

## Version
v0.2.30018

description: Investigated auto-sync indicator showing on SiriusXM: Sports Talk. Found that the frontend logic is working correctly - the group is marked as auto-sync because the Infinity M3U account has group 86 configured with auto_channel_sync: true and group_override: 371 (SiriusXM: Sports Talk). This is a backend data configuration issue, not a frontend bug. The indicator correctly shows that group 371 receives auto-created channels from group 86. title: Fix mismatched filter section heights between Channels and Streams panes
description: The filter areas have different heights due to different filter row structures.

description: Added option to renumber source group after moving channels to a different group. When channels are moved out of a group and create gaps in the channel numbering, a checkbox appears in the cross-group move modal offering to 'Close gaps in source group'. description: Redesigned the cross-group move modal to use radio button selections instead of action buttons. Options (Keep current numbers, Assign sequential numbers, Custom number) are now selectable with a single 'Move Channel(s)' button at the bottom. The custom number input only appears when that option is selected. This makes the modal flow clearer and more intuitive.

title: Fix dropping channels at end of group
description: Added DroppableGroupEnd component using @dnd-kit's useDroppable hook to allow dropping channels at the end of a group. Updated handleDragOver and handleDragEnd to handle group-end-{groupId} drop targets. The drop zone appears after the last channel in each group and shows a drop indicator line when hovering.

title: Fix group-end drop zone detection for cross-group moves
description: Fixed group-end drop zone detection by moving DroppableGroupEnd outside SortableContext. Also moved custom number input inline within the radio option selection.

title: Fix undo/redo not updating UI in ChannelsPane
description: Fixed undo/redo not visually reverting changes in the UI. The issue was that ChannelsPane has its own localChannels state for drag operations, which was only syncing with the channels prop when entering/exiting edit mode. Now it also syncs when channels changes during edit mode (which happens when undo/redo updates the workingCopy), but only when not actively dragging to preserve drag state.

title: Batch related operations into single undo/redo point
description: Implemented batch undo/redo to group multiple related operations into a single undo point. Added UndoEntry type that contains an array of StagedOperations. Added startBatch/endBatch functions to useEditMode hook. Updated handleCrossGroupMoveConfirm and handleDragEnd to wrap multiple operations in a batch. Now moving channels between groups or reordering within a group creates a single undo point regardless of how many individual channel updates occur.

title: Smarter undo batching for cross-group channel moves
description: Implemented smarter undo batching for cross-group channel moves. Now creates separate undo entries for each logical phase: (1) Move channels to target group, (2) Shift existing channels in target group if inserting at a position, (3) Renumber remaining channels in source group if closing gaps. This gives users 1-3 undo steps instead of one giant batch, allowing them to step through the operation logically.

title: Show undo entry count instead of individual operation count
description: Changed stagedOperationCount to show the number of undo entries (batches) instead of individual operations. This means if a cross-group move creates 3 batches (move, shift, renumber) containing 14 total operations, the UI will show '3 changes' instead of '14 changes'.

title: Fix modifiedChannelIds not updating correctly on undo/redo operations
description: Added computeModifiedChannelIds helper function that compares working copy against baseline snapshot. Updated localUndo and localRedo to recalculate modifiedChannelIds after each operation, so the 'modified' highlighting accurately reflects only channels that differ from baseline at each step.

title: Sort and renumber channels in a group - sort alphabetically by name and renumber starting at user-chosen number

Clicking it opens a modal that shows a preview of channels sorted alphabetically with sequential numbers starting from a user-chosen number. The operation is batched as a single undo step.

title: Add option to strip channel numbers from names when sorting

The option is enabled by default and includes: new state (sortStripNumbers), helper function (getNameForSorting), updated sorting logic in both confirm handler and preview, checkbox UI in modal, and CSS styling.

title: Create README.md documentation

title: Add security scanning to CI/CD pipeline

All security scans must pass before the build job can run.

title: Fix Python dependency security vulnerabilities

Also updated uvicorn, httpx, pydantic, and pydantic-settings to latest stable versions.

Fix DAST scan still failing on warnings

Release version 0.1.0 to main

title: WebSocket integration for real-time EPG progress updates
description:
## Feature Request
Add WebSocket integration with Dispatcharr to show real-time EPG refresh progress like the Dispatcharr UI does.

## Current State
ECM polls the REST API every 2 seconds during refresh, but can only see:
- status: 'fetching' or 'parsing'
- last_message: Only updated when operation completes

## Desired State
Show real-time progress messages like Dispatcharr's UI:
- 'Downloading' with speed/progress
- 'Extracting' for compressed files
- 'Parsing channels' with batch progress
- 'Parsing programs' with percentage

## Technical Details
- Dispatcharr WebSocket endpoint: ws://host:port/ws/
- Message type: 'update' with 'data' containing progress info
- Actions: 'downloading', 'extracting', 'parsing_channels', 'parsing_programs'
- Updates sent via channel_layer.group_send() to 'updates' group

## Implementation Notes
1. Create WebSocket client to connect to Dispatcharr
2. Subscribe to EPG progress updates
3. Update EPG Manager UI with real-time progress messages
4. Handle reconnection on disconnect

title: Order streams by quality AND provider for failover
description:
Enhanced sortStreamsByQuality() to order streams by quality AND provider for failover redundancy.

Algorithm:
1. Group streams by quality tier (UHD/4K → FHD/1080p → HD/720p → SD/480p)
2. Within each quality tier, group by provider (m3u_account)
3. Interleave streams round-robin style across providers

Example ordering:
- Provider 1 ESPN FHD
- Provider 2 ESPN FHD
- Provider 1 ESPN HD
- Provider 2 ESPN HD

This ensures that if a provider fails, the next stream in the failover chain is from a different provider at the same quality level.

notes: Fixed: Changed condition from 'if (newName \!== channel.name)' to 'if (newName && newName \!== channel.name)' in handleSortRenumberConfirm at line 3187.
